name: Northern Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Stems: up to 3m long, often reddish, branching

Leaves: two types: submersed – finely feather divided (1-5cm long), 5-14 leaflet pairs, whorls of 4-5 leaves, internodal space up to 1cm; emergent (bract) – entire or slightly serrated margin, same length or longer than flowers, arranged in whorls; internodal space up to 1cm
Flowers: midsummer, tiny, develop on emergent spikes (4-15 cm), arranged in whorls
Fruits/Seeds: nutlike, up to 3mm diameter, separate into 4 chambers, 1 seed per chamber
Habitat: Prefer quiet waters of lakes and streams
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northern and western United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
